summary.text:
Patterns are the building blocks of Zen. They are used to generate patterns of values in interesting, concise ways. 
Pattern methods can be chained together.
Pattern methods can be prefixed with a $ to create a new pattern; for example, $add. The results of each pattern are combined together.
Shorthand aliases for pattern methods.

content.text:
```ts
a: 'add',
an: 'and',
b: 'bin',
bm: 'btms',
bs: 'bts',
cl: 'clamp',
c: 'coin',
cc: 'midicc',
co: 'cosine',
cu: 'curve',
d: 'div',
dr: 'divr',
e: 'else',
eq: 'eq',
ev: 'every',
i: 'if',
intrp: 'interpolate',
inv: 'inversion',
in: 'invert',
la: 'layer',
mo: 'mod',
m: 'mul',
n: 'not',
no: 'noise',
nb: 'ntbin',
o: 'or',
of: 'often',
pu: 'pulse',
rd: 'random',
ra: 'range',
r: 'rarely',
sa: 'saw',
se: 'seq',
v: 'set',
si: 'sine',
sq: 'square',
st: 'step',
so: 'sometimes',
s: 'sub',
sr: 'subr',
t: 'toggle',
tr: 'tri',
trig: 'trigger',
tu: 'tune',
u: 'use',
x: 'xor',
qm: 'qmeasure',
qms: 'qmeasures',
qpb: 'qprobability',
qpbs: 'qprobabilities',
qamp: 'qamplitude',
qamps: 'qamplitudes',
qr: 'qresult',
```

summary.text:
Return to parent Pattern or Stream
Useful when using any of the dollar methods, which spawn new Patterns, allowing you to return to this original pattern.
Or, use as shorthand to access the underlying stream
Get the absolute value of the previous value in the pattern chain
Get the arccosine of the previous value in the pattern chain
Add a value to the previous value in the pattern chain.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Compare the previous value in the pattern chain with a value.

content.text:
```ts
s0.e.every(3).add(t%2)
Or, use $and to create a new pattern and compare it with the previous pattern in the chain.
```

summary.text: a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Get the arctangent of the previous value in the pattern chain

Get a value from the previous value in the pattern chain, at index n
The previous value can be either an array - so n must be an integer...
...or an object - so n must be a string
index of value to retrieve
Get the arctangent of the previous value in the pattern chain
Get the arctangent of the previous value in the pattern chain
value to divide by
Generate truthy or falsy values from a binary string.

content.text:
```ts
s0.e.bin('1111') // output depends on the number of division per cycle / canvas. If 16, returns 1 every 4 divisions, 0 otherwise
```

summary.text: binary string
Convert the previous value from beats to milliseconds, scaling by bpm
Convert the previous value from beats to seconds, scaling by bpm
Return the current cycle
Get the ceiling of the previous value in the pattern chain
Clamp the previous value in the pattern chain to a range.
Alias for
`sometimes`
Get the cosine of the previous value in the pattern chain
Generate a cosine wave between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
Generate a curve between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
lowest value in range
highest value in range
curve of the pattern. Default is 0.5, which means a linear curve.
number of iterations of the pattern, either per cycle or per canvas. Default is 1, which means once per cycle.
Divide the previous value in the pattern chain by a value.

content.text:
```ts
s0.p.n.noise(60,72,1).div(2)
Or, use $div to create a new pattern and divide it by the previous pattern in the chain.
```

summary.text: a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Reverse divide the previous value in the pattern chain by a value.

content.text:
```ts
s0.p.modi.noise(1,2).divr(2)
Or, use $divr to create a new pattern and divide it by the previous pattern in the chain.
```

summary.text: a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string

Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is a truthy or falsy value
If false return new value, if true, simply pass on the previous value
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is equal to a value using ==.
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is an even number
Generate truthy or falsy values every n divisions.
Get the exponential of the previous value in the pattern chain
Get the floor of the previous value in the pattern chain
Provide a callback function to the previous value in the pattern chain
callback function
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is greater than a value.
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is greater than or equal to a value.

Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is a truthy or falsy value
If true return new value, if false, simply pass on the previous value
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Interpolate between a value and the previous value in the pattern chain
value to interpolate to
Invert the previous chord in the pattern chain
inversion

Invert the previous value in the pattern chain - like a bitwise NOT.
Returns a 0 if true, and a 1 if false.

On/off. Returns 1 when on, 0 when off.
True values passed to the first argument will turn the pattern on, false values are ignored.
True values passed to the second argument will turn the pattern off, false values are ignored.
Layer a value on top of the previous value in the pattern chain, forming an array of values
Get the natural log of the previous value in the pattern chain
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is less than a value.
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is less than or equal to a value.
Get the maximum of the previous value in the pattern chain and a given value
value to compare to
Use a midi cc on the selected device
control change number
midi device index (default is 0)
initial value (default is 1)
Use the currently pressed key(s) on the selected device
midi device index (default is 0)
Get the minimum of the previous value in the pattern chain and a given value
value to compare to

Modulo the previous value in the pattern chain by a value.
Or, use $mod to pass the outcome of a pattern to the function
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Map the preceding value in the chain to a new range.
the new minimum value
the new maximum value
Multiply the previous value in the pattern chain by a value.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is not equal to a value using !=.
Generate a number between lo and hi, using a simplex noise function.
Negate the value passed as the first argument
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Convert a number to binary string, then passes it to .bin().

content.text:
```ts
s0.p.n.ntbin(9, 8) // 9 in binary is 1001, padded out to 8 digits. Passes 00001001 to .bin()
```

the length of the binary string
number of iterations of the pattern, either per cycle or per canvas. Default is 1, which means once per cycle.
value to return when true
value to return when false
Test if the previous value in the pattern chain is an odd number
75/25 chance of returning a 1 or 0
Returns a 1 the first time it is called, and 0 thereafter
Compare the previous value in the pattern chain with a value.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Modify the value returned by a previous iteration of the pattern
Multiply the previous value in the pattern chain to the power of a given value
value to multiply by
Post the current value to the console
Generate a pulse wave between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
Return the amplitude coefficient for a given state of the quantum system
state to get amplitude of, as an integer
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Returns an array of amplitude coefficients for all possible states of the quantum system
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Return the value of the measured qubit
qubit to measure
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Return all measurements of the system as an array
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.

state to get phase of, as an integer
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Returns an array of phases for all possible states of the quantum system
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Return all probabilities of the system as an array
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Return the probability of the qubit being measured as 1
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.

Returns the index of the state with the highest amplitude
If there are multiple states with the same amplitude, one is chosen at random
number of measurements to take before looping. Default is 0 (no looping). Max 256.
Generate a random number between lo and hi.
Generate a range of values between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
25/75 chance of returning 1 or 0
Round the previous value in the pattern chain
Generate a saw wave between lo and hi. Alias of range. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
Choose from a sequence of values. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
an array of values
number of iterations of the sequence, either per cycle or per canvas. Default is 1, which means once per cycle.
Set a single value

content.text:
```ts
s0.x.set(t => t) // run a function, with the first argument being the current time
```

summary.text: a single string or number or array of strings or numbers, or a Pattern, or a Zen pattern string
Get the sine of the previous value in the pattern chain
Generate a sine wave between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
50/50 chance of returning 1 or 0. Also, use
`coin()`
Get the square root of the previous value in the pattern chain
Generate a square wave between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain. See also pulse.
lowest value in range
highest value in range
number of iterations of the pattern, either per cycle or per canvas. Default is 1, which means once per cycle.
Round the previous value in the pattern chain to the step value.
value to round to
Subtract a value from the previous value in the pattern chain.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Reverse subtract. Subtract the previous value in the pattern chain from a value.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Return the current time
Get the tangent of the previous value in the pattern chain

Toggle on or off using the value passed as the first argument
A true value will toggle the pattern on, a false value will toggle it off
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string
Generate a triangle wave between lo and hi. Use as the first call in a pattern chain.
Convert the previous value from divisions of a bar to seconds, scaling by bpm
Round the previous value in the pattern chain to the nearest value in an array.
array of values to round to
Inset another pattern's stack into the current pattern's stack
an instance of another pattern
Compare the previous value in the pattern chain with a value.
a value, instance of Pattern, or Zen pattern string

A stream is a musical layer. You can use a stream to map musical parameters across time and space. 
When a stream triggers an event, musical parameters are determined by the stream's position in time and space.
When a stream triggers a mutation, all active events are mutated based on the stream's position in time and space.

Streams are available within Zen as

content.text:
```ts
s0.set({inst: 'synth', n: 60}) // set the stream's default parameters
s0.p.lag.set(1).btms()
s0.px._modi.saw(1,10) // map the synth's modulation index across the x axis
s0.py._harm.range(0,10,1) // map the synth's harmonic series across the y axis
s0.x.saw() // move the stream across the x axis of the canvas
s0.y.noise(0,1,0,0.5) // move the stream across the y axis of the canvas
s0.e.every(4) // trigger an event every 4 divisions
s0.m.not(s0.e)
```

summary.text: Shorthand aliases for pattern methods
An object used to map parameter names to different keys. Useful for mapping to MIDI controllers
Patterns to be mapped across time

content.text:
```ts
s0.p.amp.range(0,1) // ramp amp from 0 to 1 across the cycle
```

summary.text: Patterns to be mapped across the x axis

content.text:
```ts
s0.px.amp.range(0,1) // ramp amp from 0 to 1 across the x axis of the canvas
```

summary.text: Patterns to be mapped across the y axis

content.text:
```ts
s0.py.amp.range(0,1) // ramp amp from 0 to 1 across the y axis of the canvas
```

summary.text: Patterns to be mapped across the z axis

content.text:
```ts
s0.pz.amp.range(0,1) // ramp amp from 0 to 1 across the z axis of the canvas
```

summary.text:
The wire is used to add gates to a quantum circuit
see Wire class documentation for more information
A Pattern for determining whether the stream should trigger an event

content.text:
```ts
s0.e.set(1) // trigger an event every division
s0.e.every(4) // trigger an event every 4 divisions
s0.e.bin('1000 1001') // use a binary pattern to trigger events
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to mutate all active events in the stream. Only mutates parameters prefixed with
, e.g.
`_amp`

content.text:
```ts
s0.m.set(1) // mutate all active events every division
s0.m.every(4) // mutate all active events every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to mute the stream

content.text:
```ts
s0.mute.set(1) // mute the stream every division
s0.mute.every(4) // mute the stream every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to solo the stream. If true, mutes all other streams

content.text:
```ts
s0.solo.set(1) // solo the stream every division
s0.solo.every(4) // solo the stream every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the stream's position in time

content.text:
```ts
s0.t.sine(0,16,1) // override the global t with a sine wave between 0 and 16
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

content.text:
```ts
s0.x.saw() // move the stream across the x axis of the canvas with a saw wave
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting all axes of the stream's position at the same time. Expects an array of values
A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

content.text:
```ts
s0.y.saw() // move the stream across the y axis of the canvas with a saw wave
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

content.text:
```ts
s0.z.saw() // move the stream across the z axis of the canvas with a saw wave
```

summary.text: Set multiple stream parameter using key/value pairs
key/value pairs

The Wire class represents a single wire in a quantum circuit.
It uses the Quantum Circuit package to implement quantum gates. 
Some gates are documented here. See https://www.npmjs.com/package/quantum-circuit#implemented-gates for a list of all implemented gates.
Toffoli gate, or CCNOT gate
index or array of indexes
number of columns to skip
Controlled NOT gate, or CNOT gate
index or array of indexes
number of columns to skip
Use the last measure as the initial state of the qubit
index of the stream to use
Hadamard gate
number of columns to skip
Generate a random circuit
number of qubits
number of gates
Rotation around the X-axis by given angle
multiple of PI
number of columns to skip
Rotation around the Y-axis by given angle
multiple of PI
number of columns to skip
Rotation around the Z-axis by given angle
multiple of PI
number of columns to skip
Single qubit rotation with 3 Euler angles
[theta, phi, lambda] - multiples of PI
number of columns to skip
PI rotation over X-axis, also known as NOT gate
number of columns to skip
PI rotation over Y-axis
number of columns to skip
PI rotation over Z-axis
number of columns to skip
The Zen class allows you to set global parameters. It is available within Zen as

content.text:
```ts
z.t.range(0, 16, 1) // pattern time
z.bpm.range(60, 120, 1) // pattern bpm
z.s = 16 // size of canvas
z.q = 16 // frames per cycle
z.update = 1 // when to update the executed code, 1 is on the next division, q is on the next cycle etc.
z.set({reverb: 1, rsize: 0.5}) // set global parameters for all streams. Can be overwritten by stream parameters
z.p.n.scales('d-dorian', 16) // set global time parameters using z.p
z.px._modi.range(0, 1, 0.25) // set global stream parameters using z.px
etc.
```

A Pattern for setting the global bpm

content.text:
```ts
z.bpm.saw(60,120,0.5) // set the global bpm with a saw wave between 60 and 120, over 2 cycles
```

summary.text: Get the current cycle. This is available within your code as

content.text:
```ts
s0.e.every(c%2 ? 1 : 4) // every 1 frame on odd cycles, every 4 frames on even cycles
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether the stream should trigger an event

content.text:
```ts
s0.e.set(1) // trigger an event every division
s0.e.every(4) // trigger an event every 4 divisions
s0.e.bin('1000 1001') // use a binary pattern to trigger events
```

summary.text: A Pattern for displaying data on the grid. Expects an array of numbers between 0 and 1

content.text:
```ts
z.grid.set(Array.from({length: 16*16}, () => Math.random())) // random values between 0 and 1
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the global latency

content.text:
```ts
z.latency.set(500) // set the global latency to 500ms
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to mutate all active events in the stream. Only mutates parameters prefixed with
, e.g.
`_amp`

content.text:
```ts
s0.m.set(1) // mutate all active events every division
s0.m.every(4) // mutate all active events every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to mute the stream

content.text:
```ts
s0.mute.set(1) // mute the stream every division
s0.mute.every(4) // mute the stream every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: Set the number of divisions per cycle. Changing this value updates the variable
within your code.

content.text:
```ts
z.q = 16 // set the number of divisions per cycle to 16
```

summary.text: Set the size of the canvas. Changing this value updates the variable
within your code.

content.text:
```ts
z.s = 16 // set the size of the canvas to 16
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the global seeding

content.text:
```ts
z.seed.saw(0,1,0.5) // set the global seed with a saw wave between 0 and 1, over 2 cycles
```

summary.text: A Pattern for determining whether to solo the stream. If true, mutes all other streams

content.text:
```ts
s0.solo.set(1) // solo the stream every division
s0.solo.every(4) // solo the stream every 4 divisions
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the global swing. A value between 0 and 1
A Pattern for setting the global swing subdivision, e.g. 8 for 1/8th notes, 16 for 1/16ths
A Pattern for setting the global time. The outcome of the pattern updates the variable
within your code.

content.text:
```ts
z.t.sine(0,16,1) // set the global t with a sine wave between 0 and 16
```

summary.text: Set when to update the executed code

content.text:
```ts
z.update = 1 // update on every frame
z.update = 4 // update on every 4th frame
z.update = q // update on the next cycle
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

content.text:
```ts
s0.x.saw() // move the stream across the x axis of the canvas with a saw wave
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting all axes of the stream's position at the same time. Expects an array of values
A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

content.text:
```ts
s0.y.saw() // move the stream across the y axis of the canvas with a saw wave
```

summary.text: A Pattern for setting the stream's position in space

```ts

```

readme.text:
# Zen Quantum
Zen is a live coding environment for expressing complex patterns with very little code. It was written to take advantage of JavaScript's flexibility and is primed for pattern interference. Design and run quantum circuits and use the results to trigger musical events. Map musical and sonic parameters across time and space and draw multiple trajectories around a canvas to generate infinitely complex, morphing sounds.

Full documentation and a tutorial are available at [https://zen.cephasteom.co.uk](https://zen.cephasteom.co.uk).
